Reviews.Title: “Very good; location, cleanliness, and staff...”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed_Omar
Reviews.Content: We booked Alkoclar Keban Hotel for our 7-night trip to Istanbul. The hotel was very central in terms of location; all resturants and other shops were literaly at the door's steps. Famous Istiqlal shopping streets is only 2 minutes away and Taksim-Kabatash underground station is just infront of it. Our room was very small but it is worth to mentions how modern, clean, and orgnised it was. More importantly, the bathroom was large and truly modern in its decoration. Breakfast, however, was very limited in selections and I did not like the fact that to order Omlet eggs it would cost you 8 Turkish Liera! Another bothering point was the single lift that took long time to serve all the floors and therefore it was very normal for us to wait for at least 5 minutes to ride it. In general, the tidy rooms, friendly staff, and central location haave all compensated the negative 2 points I just mentioned. I recommend it for those who like to be out at the busy nights of Istanboul and would prefer to be in city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: hotelhopper87
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Turkey and I didn't really know what to expect. The negative reviews on this hotel are all mainly from before they had it renovated. I was there for New Year 2012 and all I can say is that this hotel was absolutely fantastic. The staff were very friendly, rooms very clean and tidy, and best of all is the location which is right on Taksim Square and parallel to Istiklal street. I had stayed with a friend in a standard room which had twin beds. The room was quite small but still very comfortable. Our stay included free WiFi and free breakfast which was alright. The variety wasn't much but it was still a great way to start the day. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely consider staying there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “very bad food”
Reviews.Author: mohamed e
Reviews.Content: i was in honeymoon and room was ok but the view was bad, the breakfast was too bad and without varieties and the only good thing was the location which was in Taksim square from where you can have any transportaion method to any where .

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, Excellent rooms, Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: xopolkadot84ox
Reviews.Content: my mum, sister and i, have just returned from the alkoclar keban hotel where we stayed in a family room (16-22nd Jan 2012). We had chosen alkoclar keban because of its close proximity to taksim square and because the rooms appeared to be of a very good standard for the price. Upon arrival, we were very pleased with our choice! The hotel is in an excellent location, literally 5 doors away from the start of istiklal street in taksim sqaure. The rooms are very classy with brand new fittings, beds and furniture and are extremely clean and look exactly like the professional pictures which appear on the hotels website. Having previously stayed in the five star elite world hotel in taksim sqaure, I can honestly say that the rooms are of the same standard. Our room had a minibar/fridge, kettle with tea/coffee, tv (with 4 channels- all in turkish), and a safe however the website states that rooms have a microwave but this is definitely a misprint! we stayed in the family room which had two single bed and one large double bed. Rooms also had free complementary wi-fi, however the connection was very slow and often tempermental. The bathroom was grey marble, very clean, with new and very fancy fittings including: a large marble sink, bidet toilet, a rainshower head and a hairdryer. However, when using the rainshower head, water often leaked onto the tiled floor which was the only downfall. The buffet breakfast would be served between 7am and 10 (30) a.m and was slightly varied each day with a selection of around 4 hot dishes, often: scrambled eggs, arabic cheese/spinach pastry, (halal) sausages and a meat/egg stir fry. The buffet also included a selection of cheeses, dried fruit and figs, olives, yoghurts, cereals and breads with complementary cherry or orange juice, tea/ or turkish style coffee (however, all drinks had to be to ordered seperately through a waiter). The service: The hotel staff were all very friendly and always on hand however, it was extremely difficult to communicate with daytime staff since they neither spoke nor understood english. it was really difficult to communicate something as simple as wanting some milk for our tea or that we needed 2 clean glasses (we were instead brought 2 tea bags to our room?!). This however became less of an issue as we later discovered that the kind man who worked on reception during the night and the male manager who worked in the back office during the day were much more fluent in english. if we needed help with locations or directions during the day we found that staff in the taksimhill hotel (further down the street, just before the corner facing the metro) spoke excellent english, in particular one reception worker named volkan, who was very helpful and always willing to help. location: the hotel faces a whole line of minimarts, a bakery, a money exchange and several takeaway restaurants which are practically open all night. The money exchange closes at midnight, however 2-3 of the minimarts also exchange pounds and euros which is very handy. There is a shisha cafe literally 2 doors to the left of the hotel and the metro is less than a 2 min walk with a starbucks opposite. The street that the hotel is on is very lively even at 5am and feels very safe as it is often used as a police checkpoint (which can get a little noisy at night) and there are always a lot of people around. Expect to pay between 50 and 55 tlr for a taxi to/ from ataturk airport to the hotel and a maximum of 25 tlr to the blue mosque. In all, we really enjoyed our stay at the alkoclar keban hotel and especially loved the amazing location of this hotel and will defintely be recommending this hotel to friends and family and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent choice for a group of friends”
Reviews.Author: Allam_Abeer
Reviews.Content: We were a group of friends , four , and we stayed in a family room. The positive things: 1- Location: excellent, very close to the Istaklal shopping area, close to the metro and bus station. 2- Service: Very clean rooms , very polite staff and an excellent breakfast. 3- Rooms: were big enough for us and the beds were comfortable. The negative things: (minor) 1- There is only one lift in the hotel , so you had to wait a little for it , not much 2- The internet connection in the rooms was very slow, however it was fast in the sitting area outside the room. 3- The breakfast, though generous, the variety wasn't much. 4- There was no variety with the TV channels. However we have enjoyed our stay there and would stay there again. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad A
Reviews.Content: we made reservation with travel agency they told us Alkoclar Keban is a New good, clean, reasonably price hotel in the centrer of the city. Stayed in with our family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children) and we liked hotel. They have familiy room one double bed and two single bed. We only crossed street to reached Istiklal. stuff always smile and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Fatima A
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week and special thanks to Burcu for the room reserved for us with Bosphorus wiew on the 6th floor. Room was very comfortable. stuff very friendly and helpful. We highly recommand this hotel extremely well located, on the TAKSIM

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nessrin D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cozzy , rooms are very clean , breakfast excellent with view, Overall is very good

Reviews.Title: “YES”
Reviews.Author: saeed a
Reviews.Content: we were happy with the rooms and employees performance. Iwould recommend thÄ±s hotel to other frÄ±ends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charbel123
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at this hotel. I am surprised with the reviews, the only explanation might be a renovation that recently took place. The staff was extremely friendly, the room was very clean and the furniture is new and modern. The washroom was clean, there was no tub but the shower area is perfect and equipped with new and modern fittings. The AC was OK, but with temperature around 40C outside, we felt the cooling wasn't that efficient. The location might be the best in Istanbul. The rooms are not large, but compared to hotel rooms in Europe, they're spacious. I totally recommend this hotel, I don't understand the old reviews, but our experience was amazing, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Vacation Place”
Reviews.Author: ZEBANI
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpfull and very kind. We had a welcoming drink and a briefing of what to do and where to go Rooms are clean and very comfortable. For sure if we come to istanbul we will go to Alkoclar Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolut quality!”
Reviews.Author: Qaderoo
Reviews.Content: We spent our Honeymoon here in Istanbul with my wife at this marwelous hotel. All the staff were nice especially the Hotel Manager (Mr. Sedat it was i guess). they showed us best hospitality and kindness. I suggest all "Just Marrieds" to spend a great honeymoon via staying in Alkoclar ! Thanks Sedat !

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad.”
Reviews.Author: frequentraveller39
Reviews.Content: My travel agency booked two rooms for me at this hotel. When I read the reviews I was really scared and I asked the agency manager to cancel the booking and to find another hotel. The manager told me that the hotel was completely renovated and that the work is completed. He also told me he had just spent three days at the hotel on a trial and that he was satisfied. I believed him and so I went. I was not disappointed at all. I stayed with my family for 8 days (B&B). The hotel was in fact renovated from from A to Z, including beds,sheets and lift too ! Most of the staff at the reception spoke good English, which was not the case for the restaurant staff. Rooms are quite small but clean. Excellent location, 100 meters from Taksim square and Istiqlal Street, bus and metro stations. Quite noisy at night. If you want to have a fair evaluation of the hotel, read the reviews posted after June 2011.

Reviews.Title: “we like it and we 'll be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: jnjoom
Reviews.Content: it has wonderful location in a very good area near everything . very good reception but very very small rooms inside if i come back to istanbul again iwill be 100% come back to it again

Reviews.Title: “entirely redone”
Reviews.Author: aw_berlin2001
Reviews.Content: After a complete renovation this hotel is (still?) to be avoided. At least in April 2011 the hotel was definitely not ready to receive guests. Rooms are small and noisy. The carpentry seems to be made by someone who does not have a clue, and nothing is straight in the room. The summit of my stay was constuction work at 2am - incl. drilling next to my room. They did not even bother to apologise. Internet is free also in the rooms - connexion rather slow though. Avoid the place. The entire Taksim Area, so popular with tourist, is to be avoided - most places are bad tourist traps; there are such nice areas in Istanbul where people are nice and nobody is cheating on anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended; aweful experience”
Reviews.Author: RihamR
Reviews.Content: I had the worse experience at this hotel. Despite its perfect location middle of taksim just facing Istiklal street which makes it easy to go out at night; the hotel is disgustingly small with stuffy-smelled furniture both in reception, restaurant & rooms. The check-in was fine; then came the invetion of elevators, one of the present two almost occupies only two guests sticking to each other no space for bags. The rooms were not very small but very stuffy & dark, beds were not clean & had an odour. The bathroom, basin & toilet were manageable but the bath tub!!! I had the feeling that the bath tub will collapse into the room under our floor. In bed, second & third night something has bitten my ankle, not sure if it ant, mosquito or what but it was very itchy. The Restaurant is under the ground!!! Again stuffy & poorly furnished, staff are busy chatting to each other. Good food variety but not tasty quality. The worse that happened is that on the third day while returning in the evening from shopping heading to our room, the electronic key didn't open our room we tried several times with no luck; my friend & I descended to the reception to ask for assitance. The rep in the reception told us that the housekeeping has collected our stuff from the bathroom & room into one of our bags & moved the stuff into another room on the 1st floor!!!!!!! Just like that without asking us or notifying us... & why was that because they have a guest who wants to stay beside his friend so they decided to give him our room!!!!!!!!!! God they have no idea of hospitality.. Ofcourse we cant overlook the fact that there is a vety big problem in communication.. such a high location & staff cant speak two english words?!!!!

Reviews.Title: “no value for money”
Reviews.Author: lek82
Reviews.Content: the bed linen, the courtain, pilow have holes. the bathroom smells and have mould. the windows don't close good so the wind blows into the room.also because the window recess are very old the noise is nery loud and you can sleep and rest,is like they toot the horn in our rooms

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible 2 Stars Hotel at Max”
Reviews.Author: SherifElSissy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights, and everyday when the hour of going back to the hotel comes the feeling we had was terrible. Rooms are too small. Beds are too small. Sheets are very old and not clean. Curtains are old and torn out. Water never flows in the bath tub. Some insects were fond in the room. AC is not working. Istanbul is a nice city so avoid this hotel to make your stay a nice one.

Reviews.Title: “very bad and dirty”
Reviews.Author: sarooh
Reviews.Content: this hotel sucks i do not understand how it is classified as a 4 star hotel we stayed for 1 night only, the area is good for shopping but too noisy at night, the ac is bad, the beds r yucky the receptionists r not so friendly, the breakfast sucks as in taste and quality adding that the table sheets are torn and very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “bad selection”
Reviews.Author: IranEbrahim
Reviews.Content: i stayed in keban hotel for one week.tv not functionig properly,refrigrator not working,air conditioner from4am upto8am was working just as a fan.when you claim about this problem nobody feel the responsibility to folow your problem.it is imposibe to found hotel manager.in the third night of staying there i was so cofused from this situation specialy from air condition problem and the reciption man ask to call police for me.so i found it if i want to waste my time on hotel problem i wil lose my trip enjoy so i tryed to aaccept it.another problem is i had some message by call but nobody is responsible to convaye the mesage for you.it is not four star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: MySweetTurkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very nice location and I always choose this location to my stay but the hotel is reaaly unclean. The rooms are very old and bed blanket are having some cuts on it which means they are very old. The T.V. is very old too and sometimes channels are not working. This hotel doesn't deserve to be a 4 stars hotel, it deserve to be 2 or maximum 3 stars hotel no more. They have to make a whole repair for all things.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting... disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous011
Reviews.Content: It was the most terrible experienceâ€¦. I can tell that the hotel shared in ruining our vacationâ€¦ Disgusting is a word that can't start to explain or describe how horrible this place wasâ€¦ I can't even call it a hotelâ€¦ it should be rated less than 1 star. The receptionists were so rude and aggressive, the room smells, the bath tub leaksâ€¦ fungus was allover the bathroom, the curtains were torn, the A/C wasn't working, even the mini-bar was broken. The Breakfast was tasteless and lacked variety, and though that the location was good, the place was very noisy and couldn't sleep all night. Please don't believe the pictures on the internet because it's not real. It's a horrible, disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MoGiNa
Reviews.Content: this hotel is horrible by all means!!! I have never seen such treatment, the recptionists were so rude and they tried to charge us with phone calls that we never did... the room is so depressing and the pictures are totally unreal. the AC barely worked. The bath tub was leaking and there were fungus and mold in the bathroom!! the food was horrible and lacked variety. I dont know how this hotel was given 4 stars...it should be given only one star if less for its location and there are other hotels nearby so that should not a problem. I really would suggest the Ministry of Tourism and and health organizations go check this horrible hotel. also, receptionists should be given a training on how to treat tourists and guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: BarnsleyGod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst I have ever stayed in. Dingy and depressing are scarcely bad enough to describe it. The food however is something else, fit only for pigs. We were served freezing cold food that had been cooked at least 2 hours earlier and the following day when the hotel had a reserved time for our dinner, it still served up cold food. Book this hotel at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “Vacationing in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Aya-Rose
Reviews.Content: I actually enjoyed my room over looking Taksim. I was able to open my window & watch the people & vehicles moving around. The hotel's location was near places to eat & the buses. Hotel staff were friendly & the breakfast foods were light and tasty. The only problem we had was with the bathroom sink pipe, it was broken & leaked on the floor but within five minutes of calling hotel staff, someone came & fixed it immediately. Our room was clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy experience”
Reviews.Author: Daoud
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights in this hotel from 4 to 12 August 2006. We were a party of 5 had 2 rooms for the family. The following were our problems. 1.The air condition was inefficient sometimes in the rooms. Upon complaining and further investigating the reason, we discovered that the management switches off the AC at certain hours during the day and night. Since it was hot, nearly 35-40 C in Istanbul, it was unbearable sometimes to stay during the day in the rooms. 2.The mini bar in one room was out of order and continued to be out of order though we complained several times. It was needed badly to cool water after being out in the sun. 3.The so called worldwide satellite TV turned out to be only Turkish language TV channels. Eventually, we were cutoff the World for 7 nights. 4.The main elevator was out of order and the only functional elevator was the one designated for hotel services. It could hardly accommodate 3 persons and was busy most of the time. 5.The maintenance and many of the reception staff could not communicate in English. 6.The only treble rooms are those facing Taksim which are noisy and facing west, which means are very hot. I wouldnâ€™t advise it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ayaarlos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Keban a year ago for all together 4 nights. The hotel is lovely, though small, clean, and the staff is very nice. The only problem is that is it a bit noisy, but only if you have a room facing Taksim. The breakfast room is below ground, so no windows, but still quite delicious. I enjoyed my stay and would come stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Alkoclar Keban Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Siraselviler cd. No:17 | Taksim, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
